form.name: form1

div.span: Southington Local Schools will cancel classes and all school activities as directed by Governor DeWine through May 1, 2020.
Southington Schools earned an overall letter grade of an "A" in the Value Added Component for the District. (

Southington Schools earned an overall letter grade of a "B" on our most recent report card. Out of the three local counties, no district received an overall letter grade of an "A". Please read more about it. (

img.span: The Ohio Department of Education has named our school a 2018 High Progress School of Honor based on our school’s 2017-2018 Ohio School Report Card.

br.span: As a Momentum Award winner, our district’s report card shows our district is committed to its students’ success by ensuring students exceeded the growth expectations in English language arts and mathematics.

img.span: As an Overall A Award winner, our school’s report card shows our school is demonstrating high academic performance and building bright futures for students of every background and ability level.

h3.a: Food Distribution 10-12 drive to back of building.

div.span: Please read the attached article for information concerning the Coronavirus.

span.div: Click HERE now to order your 2019-2020 Chalker Yearbook. Pre-orders are on sale NOW for only $50. This price is valid now through May 31, 2020. We will NOT order extra books. All copies MUST be pre-ordered.

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.span:
We are back into the swing of things after a well-deserved break. Everyone is now working extremely hard in preparing for our state – wide assessments. We have been fortunate the last few years with our results. As we always mention, school success cannot be achieved without the cooperation of the entire school community. You have been excellent in working with us to achieve our goals and we THANK YOU as we hope for positive results.
Switching gears a bit, we must say that we have been fortunate with the weather. However, as we all know it could hit us at any time. With that being said, your children’s safety is our number one concern and our goal is to let you know as early as possible with any school adjustments. Two – hour delays are not popular but sometimes we need to utilize them. The less instructional time we miss the better. Let’s keep our fingers crossed.
THANKS AGAIN WE HOPE TO SEE YOU AT ONE OF OUR SCHOOL ACTIVITIES! GO WILDCATS!
Educationally yours,
Rocco Nero
Superintendent of Schools
Southington Local

span.div:
Southington Local Schools obtains various services through the Trumbull County Educational Service Center. According to Federal procurement guidelines, the following is a link to their pricing: https://www.trumbullesc.org/Downloads/TCESC%20Pricing%202019.pdf
The Trumbull County Educational Service Center is a high performing ESC. Their most current audit can be found here.

span.p: A copy of the 2019-20 Student & Parent Handbooks are available for your review.
